page.title: 06CRUELSYKE, HAYDON BRIDGE
page.content: These are two interesting houses to the north of Haydon Bridge. They stand amid Permanent pasture land.{Cruelsyke was built in the early nineteenth century, and was named after a burn which runs nearby. It was the scene of a{Border raid}after which the burn ran red with Scottish blood. Mr. & Mrs. Heslop live there now & breed successful{racing greyhounds.}The dogs are walked for miles each day. They get three meals a day and sometimes honey and sherry. We found that Mr. & Mrs. Anderson farmed forty acres at {Westley Bank}in 1851. They had nine children and employed one labourer. In 1985, Mr. &. Mrs. Nagel own the house and have two children. This illustrates the fall in{family size} over the last century. The present family owns a shop.
